verses.text_plain: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.
verses.verse_html: 1Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.

verses.text_plain: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.verse_html:
2Three years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom. ▼
▼ Maachah…: also called, Michaiah the daughter of Uriel
 , ▼
▼ Abishalom: also called, Absalom

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Maachah…: also called, Michaiah the daughter of Uriel
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Maachah…: also called, Michaiah the daughter of Uriel
▼ Abishalom: also called, Absalom

verses.text_plain: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the Lord his God, as the heart of David his father.
verses.verse_html: 3And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the Lord his God, as the heart of David his father.

verses.text_plain: Nevertheless for David’s sake did the Lord his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:
verses.verse_html:
4Nevertheless for David’s sake did the Lord his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem: ▼
▼ lamp: or, candle

verses.text_plain: Because David did that which was right in the eyes of the Lord, and turned not aside from any thing that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
verses.verse_html: 5Because David did that which was right in the eyes of the Lord, and turned not aside from any thing that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

verses.text_plain: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
verses.verse_html: 6And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
verses.verse_html: 7Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

verses.text_plain: And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 8And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.

verses.text_plain: And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.
verses.verse_html: 9And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.

verses.text_plain: And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.verse_html:
10And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom. ▼
▼ mother’s: that is, grandmother’s

footnotes.body_html: ▼ mother’s: that is, grandmother’s

verses.text_plain: And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the Lord, as did David his father.
verses.verse_html: 11And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the Lord, as did David his father.

verses.text_plain: And he took away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
verses.verse_html: 12And he took away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.

verses.text_plain: And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt it by the brook Kidron.
verses.verse_html:
13And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt it by the brook Kidron. ▼
▼ destroyed: Heb. cut off

footnotes.body_html: ▼ destroyed: Heb. cut off

verses.text_plain: But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa’s heart was perfect with the Lord all his days.
verses.verse_html: 14But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa’s heart was perfect with the Lord all his days.

verses.text_plain: And he brought in the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which himself had dedicated, into the house of the Lord, silver, and gold, and vessels.
verses.verse_html:
15And he brought in the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which himself had dedicated, into the house of the Lord, silver, and gold, and vessels. ▼
▼ things: Heb. holy

tokens.text: and the things which himself had dedicated

verses.text_plain: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.verse_html: 16And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

verses.text_plain: And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.verse_html: 17And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

verses.text_plain: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Ben–hadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
verses.verse_html: 18Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Ben–hadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,

verses.text_plain: There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
verses.verse_html:
19There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me. ▼
▼ depart: Heb. go up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ depart: Heb. go up

verses.text_plain: So Ben–hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of the hosts which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel–beth–maachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
verses.verse_html: 20So Ben–hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of the hosts which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel–beth–maachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.

tokens.text: which he had against the cities

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.
verses.verse_html: 21And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when Baasha

verses.text_plain: Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
verses.verse_html:
22Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah. ▼
▼ exempted: Heb. free

verses.text_plain: The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
verses.verse_html: 23The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.

verses.text_plain: And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html:
24And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead. ▼
▼ Jehoshaphat: Gr. Josaphat

verses.text_plain: And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years.
verses.verse_html:
25And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years. ▼
▼ began…: Heb. reigned

verses.text_plain: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.verse_html: 26And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.

verses.text_plain: And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
verses.verse_html: 27And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.

verses.text_plain: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 28Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according unto the saying of the Lord, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:
verses.verse_html: 29And it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according unto the saying of the Lord, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when he reigned

verses.text_plain: Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation wherewith he provoked the Lord God of Israel to anger.
verses.verse_html: 30Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation wherewith he provoked the Lord God of Israel to anger.

verses.text_plain: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.verse_html: 31Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

verses.text_plain: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.verse_html: 32And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

verses.text_plain: In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.
verses.verse_html: 33In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.

verses.text_plain: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.verse_html: 34And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
